text: The first time each turn that you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap, if able. The Corp removes 1 from the game; the other is added to your grip.
title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter

flavor: "Bypassing a system's defenses by cutting physical wires is what I like to call old school." - Steve Cambridge
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Derez a piece of ice that has a rez cost of X or lower.
title: Brute-Force-Hack

flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
title: Spear Phishing

flavor: Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.
title: SYN Attack

text: +1[mu], +1[link] The first time each turn you pass all of the ice protecting HQ, you may draw 1 card to force the Corp to draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Polyhistor

flavor: "Technology breeds crime."
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.
title: Abagnale

flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of sentry ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Lustig.
title: Lustig

flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.
title: Demara

text: Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. When your turn begins, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Mammon. When your turn ends, remove all hosted power counters.
title: Mammon

flavor: Know your mark, their weaknesses and strengths—both will show how to best bypass their defenses.
text:
[click], [click]: Make a run. The first time you approach a rezzed piece of ice during this run, you may pay credits equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, bypass that ice the next time you encounter it this run.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.0</errata>
title: Charlatan

flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.
text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after a successful run on HQ ends.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>.
title: Maxwell James

text:
Before drawing your starting hand, look at the top 6 cards of your stack. Set 4 of them facedown, as NVRAM. Shuffle the rest into your stack.
[click]: Add 1 card from NVRAM to your grip.
title: Ayla "Bios" Rahim: Simulant Specialist

flavor: Each AI had been tasked with finding a solution to the same problem but with different variables.
text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a card in or protecting a remote server. That card cannot be rezzed this turn.
title: Careful Planning

flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 1 additional card for each unused MU up to 4.
title: Deep Data Mining

flavor: It is not literally made of diamonds, but it is worth several times its weight in them.
text:
+1[mu], +1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
title: LLDS Memory Diamond

flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios
text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Ubax

flavor: Μεγάλο μέρος της μάθησης δεν διδάσκει την κατανόηση
text: Adept has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break sentry or barrier subroutine.
title: Adept

flavor: Δεν υπἁρχει τίποτα μόνιμο, εκτός από την αλλαγή.
text: Savant has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break 1 sentry or 2 code gate subroutines.
title: Savant

text: Install Egret only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains sentry, code gate and barrier.
title: Egret

text:
Dhegdheer can host a single program.
Lower the install cost of programs you install on Dhegdheer by 1.
The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
title: Dhegdheer

flavor: Innovation. Iteration. Education.
text: [click]: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may add 1 to your grip. Add the rest of the cards to the bottom of your stack in any order.
title: Levy Advanced Research Lab

flavor: One of the wealthiest and most powerful areas of New Angeles, Laguna Velasco is also known as the Government District.
text:
[interrupt] – Whenever you would draw cards with a basic action, increase the number of cards you will draw by 1.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Laguna Velasco District

flavor: Restructuring labor resources.
text: Gain 2[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Process Automation

text: [trash], 1[credit]: The Corp trashes 2 cards from HQ at random. Use this ability only if you suffered meat damage this turn.
title: Officer Frank

flavor: Although he rarely teaches classes these days, his lectures are always well attended.
text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.
title: Dean Lister

flavor: She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.
text: [trash]: Prevent 2 damage.
title: Biometric Spoofing

flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.
text: [click], forfeit an agenda: Play an event from your heap, ignoring all costs.
title: The Shadow Net

flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.
text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends [click] during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.
title: Seidr Laboratories: Destiny Defined

flavor: The black level clearance sub-sub-basement of Haas-Bioroid is a magical place.
text: When you score Brain Rewiring, you may pay X[credit] to force the Runner to add X cards from his or her grip to the bottom of his or her stack at random then draw 1 card.
title: Brain Rewiring

text: Place 2 agenda counters on Elective Upgrade when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Elective Upgrade

text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
title: Successful Field Test

text:
Whenever you install a card in a server, place 1 power counter on Estelle Moon.
[trash]: Draw 1 card and gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Estelle Moon.
title: Estelle Moon

text: Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it. Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins. [interrupt] – When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.) Errata from CR 1.4
title: Marilyn Campaign

flavor: "A new game means new rules..."
text:
The Runner may spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Eli 2.0.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Eli 2.0

flavor: "Strictly speaking, it isn't illegal to use an interrogation simulator as the blueprint for ICE." - Mason Bellamy
text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
title: Executive Functioning

text: [subroutine] Trace 4 If successful, the runner cannot access any cards during this run. [subroutine] Trash 1 icebreaker. Errata from FAQ 4.0
title: Holmegaard

flavor: "The Warp and Weft were hypnotic...but they didn't really seem to do anything to keep me out. But then I never seemed to find anything interesting either." - Reaver
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp may add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
title: Tapestry

flavor: "If there were hidden partitions on the server, I'd know; I'm the head of this department!"
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click][click].
Gain 10[credit] and draw 4 cards. You may install 1 card.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
title: Ultraviolet Clearance

flavor: Even knowing this floor existed was cause for termination...
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, the Runner must either take 1 brain damage or jack out. If the Runner jacks out, gain 5[credit], draw 1 card, and trash Black Level Clearance.
title: Black Level Clearance

flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."
text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.
title: Mason Bellamy

flavor: Might makes right.
text: [interrupt] – Whenever 1 or more Runner cards would be trashed (from any location), set those cards aside instead of adding them to the heap. You can look at those cards. You may remove 1 of them from the game. Then, add all of those cards that are still set aside to the heap. Ignore this ability if you have already removed a card from the game with it this turn. Errata from CR 1.4
title: Skorpios Defense Systems: Persuasive Power

text: Place 1 agenda counter on Armored Servers when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: For the remainder of this run, the Runner must trash a card from his or her grip as an additional cost to jack out or break a subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.
title: Armored Servers

flavor: "Anything, to anyone...for the right price."
text: When you score Illicit Sales, you may take 1 bad publicity. Gain 3[credit] for each bad publicity that you have.
title: Illicit Sales

text: When you score Graft, you may search your deck for up to 3 cards, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: Graft

text:
If the Runner trashes Illegal Arms Factory while it is installed, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Illegal Arms Factory

flavor:
"VP of Retirements and Pensions? So is that HR or Accounting?"
"Both."
text: Whenever the Runner takes 1 or more tags, do 1 meat damage.
title: Mr. Stone

text: [subroutine] The Runner must either trash 1 program or trash the top 2 cards from his or her stack.
title: Bloodletter

text:
You can advance this ice. It has +1 strength for each hosted advancement token.
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement tokens, instead give the Runner 2 tags.
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement tokens, instead trash 1 installed program and 1 installed resource.
title: Colossus

text:
[subroutine] Remove a card in the heap from the game.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Hailstorm

text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). [subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 4[credit].) [subroutine] End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0
title: Hortum

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
Trash 1 card.
title: Hunter Seeker

text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.
title: K. P. Lynn

text: When you score Paper Trail, trace 6 If successful, trash all connection and job resources.
title: Paper Trail

text:
If Honeyfarm is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Honeyfarm, he or she loses 1[credit].
title: Honeyfarm

text: When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Long-Term Investment. If there are at least 8[credit] on Long-Term Investment, it gains "[click]: Take any number of credits from Long-Term Investment."
title: Long-Term Investment

text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 card from his or her grip.
title: Weir

text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 13[credit].
title: IPO
